page.title: 08FARMING, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: Agriculture in this block is predominantly arable, although one farm specializes in milk production. Specialization, whether of crops or stock, is affected by E.E.C. policy and the subsidies available. Most farms are 250 - 300 acres, but many are worked as part of a larger unit, consisting of several farms, sometimes adjacent, but sometimes widely spread. Several farms in this block were parts of larger units whose land lay outside the block. Soils varied cosiderably, from thin, flinty soil on chalk in the east, to heavy clay interspersed with patches of sand on the lower land to the west. All farms had heavy investment in machinery, though they relied on contractors for some specialised crops,such as peas.
